p.s: While we humans are supposedly polluting the environment, we cause the extinction of species, the destruction of nature and its balance and will, at some point, be victims ourselves.
Is this true, and if so, what could be done against it?
Firstly, it has to be considered that before humankind started the industrialization, the nature seemed to be fine and balanced.
Secondly, when you think about what causes pollution and track these objetsobjects back, you will always end up with us humans.

For example our man-made vehicles produce plenty of CO2carbon dioxide, which results in polluted air or our synthetic plastic that lands in the oceans, is mistaken for food by animals, who then die of it.
It might seem cruel, but we humans are responsible for the environmental pollution and its destruction of earth.
The planet earth is the only known one to have allowed life to flourish on it.
There is no planet B for us.
So obviously, we urgently have to stop destroying it and ourselves.
To do so, there appear to be multiple measures.
Firstly, we should recycle our waste and preferably buy reusable products in the first place.
Like that, we limit our litter.
Secondly, we should use greener ways of transport, like public transports or electric vehicles, so as to reduce our air pollution.
Thirdly, we should find more environment friendly alternatives for our everyday activities.
For example, using solar energy instead of energy that origins from nuclear power plants.
To sum it up, we have to realise that it is us who are the reason for planet earth to be slowly falling apart.
There are many ways to try to stop this.
Clearly, this can however only be achieved if humankind unites and works towards this goal in unity.
